title: How to Make Sticky Toffee Sauce

steps.headline: Bring 1 & 1/4 cups cream, brown sugar, golden syrup, butter, and salt to boil in heavy small saucepan over medium heat, whisking until sugar dissolves.
Reduce to medium-low and cook at gentle boil until sauce coats spoon thickly and is reduced, whisking occasionally, about 10 mins.
You can add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of rum/brandy or vanilla/almond extract, if desired, and cook another 5 mins if needed.
steps.description: If you want a more salted-toffee flavour, carefully add more salt a tiny bit at a time until desired taste is reached.

steps.headline: The sauce will be brown and thick.
steps.description: Remove from heat and cool slightly. If you wish to thin it, whisk in more cream 1 tsp at a time to achieve desired consistency.

steps.headline: Pour over your dessert of choice, tastes best warm.
steps.description: Refrigerate unused portions, rewarm gently to use.

text: Bring 1 & 1/4 cups cream, brown sugar, golden syrup, butter, and salt to boil in heavy small saucepan over medium heat, whisking until sugar dissolves.  Reduce to medium-low and cook at gentle boil until sauce coats spoon thickly and is reduced, whisking occasionally, about 10 mins.  You can add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of rum/brandy or vanilla/almond extract, if desired, and cook another 5 mins if needed. If you want a more salted-toffee flavour, carefully add more salt a tiny bit at a time until desired taste is reached. The sauce will be brown and thick. Remove from heat and cool slightly. If you wish to thin it, whisk in more cream 1 tsp at a time to achieve desired consistency. Pour over your dessert of choice, tastes best warm. Refrigerate unused portions, rewarm gently to use.
